SERGEANT JOSEPH GEORGE KUSICK VA COMMUNITY LIVING CENTER

extension.searchTitle: SERGEANT JOSEPH GEORGE KUSICK VA COMMUNITY LIVING CENTER; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 120

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Designating the community living center of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Butler Township, Butler County, Pennsylvania, as the ``Sergeant Joseph George Kusick VA Community Living Center''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 2210, to designate the community living center of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Butler Township, Butler County, Pennsylvania, as the ``Sergeant Joseph George Kusick VA Community Living Center'', by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 401 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 379;

titleInfo.title: GRANTING CONSENT AND APPROVAL OF CONGRESS TO AMEND WASHINGTON AREA TRANSIT REGULATION COMPACT

extension.searchTitle: GRANTING CONSENT AND APPROVAL OF CONGRESS TO AMEND WASHINGTON AREA TRANSIT REGULATION COMPACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 120

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the joint resolution was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Granting the consent and approval of Congress for the Commonwealth of Virginia, the State of D784Maryland, and the District of Columbia to amend the Washington Area Transit Regulation Compact
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.J. Res. 92, granting the consent and approval of Congress for the Commonwealth of Virginia, the State of Maryland, and the District of Columbia to amend the Washington Area Transit Regulation Compact, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 402 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 380; and

titleInfo.title: United States House Joint Resolution 92 (115th Congress)
United States House Joint Resolution 92 (115th Congress)
GRANTING CONSENT AND APPROVAL OF CONGRESS TO ESTABLISH WASHINGTON METRORAIL SAFETY COMMISSION

extension.searchTitle: GRANTING CONSENT AND APPROVAL OF CONGRESS TO ESTABLISH WASHINGTON METRORAIL SAFETY COMMISSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 120

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the joint resolution, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Granting the consent and approval of Congress for the Commonwealth of Virginia, the State of Maryland, and the District of Columbia to enter into a compact relating to the establishment of the Washington Metrorail Safety Commission
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.J. Res. 76, amended, granting the consent and approval of Congress for the Commonwealth of Virginia, the State of Maryland, and the District of Columbia to enter into a compact relating to the establishment of the Washington Metrorail Safety Commission, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 399 yeas to 5 nays, Roll No. 381;

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>The Chair, on behalf of the Democratic Leader, pursuant to the provisions of Public Law 115-31, appointed the following individuals to serve as members of the Women's Suffrage Centennial Commission: The Honorable Barbara A. Mikulski of Maryland, Karen V. Hill of New York.<P/>Senate resumed consideration of the nomination of Patrick M. Shanahan, of Washington, to be Deputy Secretary of Defense.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 88 yeas to 6 nays (Vote No. 161), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
